newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: TENNIS-SABATINI LIKELY TO RETIRE, SAY NEWSPAPERS.
newsitem.headline: TENNIS-SABATINI LIKELY TO RETIRE, SAY NEWSPAPERS.

text.p: Argentina's Gabriela Sabatini is likely to announce her retirement from tennis at a news conference in New York on Thursday, local newspapers reported on Tuesday.
A joint statement from the Women's Tennis Association (WTA) and representatives of Sabatini confirmed the 26-year-old would hold the conference at Madison Square Garden.
The decision by Argentina's most successful tennis player, who has won 27 tournaments, follows a run of poor results, according to La Nacion and Clarin newspapers.
Clarin quoted a family member as saying "there is a 99 percent chance she will leave tennis".
Sabatini, who began playing professional tennis in 1984, has won the U.S. Open and reached the final at Wimbledon. The former world number three now ranks 29th.

"We have a very important announcement which will have a big impact in Argentina," La Nacion quoted a Sabatini associate as saying from New York. "It has to do with her future and it is a very important decision."
Asked by La Nacion if it had to do with her retirement, the unidentified associate said, "I would have to say yes, but it is better to wait until she announces it herself."
